hackathon-description-text: Presented by Association for Computing Machinery at FIT and Campus Activities Board
hackathon-eligibility:
Any college student from any school can participate. You must register prior to the event to be guaranteed a spot in the hackathon. bit.ly/2018hack
Teams will be sized 4 people or less. 
You can compete with a team of more than 4 people, but there will only be four prizes.
hackathon-requirements:
Any project that is hardware-based, software-based, a mix of both, or just an idea can be entered.
Hardware projects are anything containing physical components.
Software projects are anything involving code and programming.
Mix can be a combination of both(e.g. Arduino projects).
Idea projects are any proof of concept for a project that has research behind it and is feasible to produce.
hackathon-rules:
ALL work must be done within the 24 hours. No reusing code from previous competitions or projects. 
ALL work must be created by yourself and your team. No plagiarizing work. If you are caught, you will be banned from all FIT-ACM hackathons and events.
We will be in Evans Library for 24 hours. You must clean up where you work, eat, and sleep before you leave the library.
No food or drink is allowed in the Digital Scholarship Lab on the second floor of the library.
If you choose to be on the fourth floor of the library, this is a student-governed quiet space, and you must be respect that rule.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Arduino Nano with component starter kit(includes LEDs, buttons, headers, resistors, and potentiometers)
Virtual reality headset compatible with smartphones from 4.8" to 5.5"
Rechargeable Bluetooth speaker with color-changing LED
Choice of 16pc screwdriver set or 40pc Socket Set, and Rafter square.
Standard-sized light bulb that has up to 15 colors, and can be controlled with remote.
$20 Amazon Gift Card for Winner of Social Media Raffle

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=2949 Science Cir, Melbourne, FL 32901, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Background Research, Diversity of Disciplines, Completion of Project, Presentation, and Build a Better Future: Does it solve a relevant problem?
Background Research, Diversity of Disciplines, Completion of Project, Presentation, and Build a Better Future: Does it solve a relevant problem?
Background Research, Diversity of Disciplines, Completion of Project, Presentation, and Build a Better Future: Does it solve a relevant problem?
Best idea for a hack, even if it didn't become a product by the end of the hackathon. Based on feasibility, uniqueness, and usefulness.
Based on the aesthetic quality of the presentation, and the quality of the presenters' public speaking ability.
Share our Facebook post and tag 3 people, or forward our FITForum email to 3 people and send us a screenshot for the chance to win an Amazon Gift Card. MUST BE DONE BEFORE MARCH 23.
Come to one of the five workshops, and get entered to win a raffle.
